item.title: For the first time in nearly 6 decades, a Syrian president steps up to speak at the U.N.
item.description: Turning the page on decades of distance, Syria's President Ahmad al-Sharaa addressed the U.N. General Assembly, marking the first time any president from his country has done so in almost 60 years.

item.title: Victim's widow files the first lawsuit after January's D.C.-area midair crash
item.description: Family members of a passenger who died in the January collision are suing American Airlines, PSA Airlines, and the federal government. It's the first of what could be dozens of lawsuits.

item.title: A statue of Trump and Epstein holding hands in D.C. is removed as fast as it appeared
item.description: The statue of Trump and Epstein holding hands mid-frolic wasn't the first anti-Trump artwork on the National Mall in recent months. But it was the first to be removed, despite having a permit.

item.title: Examining Kimmel's brief suspension and Trump's threats to free speech
item.description: Jimmy Kimmel Live! is back, but New York Times reporter Adam Liptak and former Washington Post editor Marty Baron say the Trump administration is using federal power to control speech and the press.

item.title: Shooting at ICE detention facility in Dallas kills 1 detainee, injures 2 others
item.description: Authorities are investigating a fatal shooting Wednesday at a federal immigration detention facility in Dallas. One detainee was killed in what the FBI says was an act "of targeted violence."
